requirement_tested: Game lobby interface displaying available game rooms, current game status, and player information
user_persona: A casual poker enthusiast looking to quickly find and join a friendly game.
user_goal: To navigate the lobby, identify an open game room, and enter it smoothly.

narrative_steps.title: Entering the Lobby
narrative_steps.description: Sarah logs in and lands on the lobby page. She immediately sees a list of available game rooms against the azure background with midnight blue cards.
narrative_steps.action: Load the lobby page at '/lobby'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page loads successfully showing multiple room cards with details like room name, player count, and status.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Room Details
narrative_steps.description: Sarah hovers her mouse over a room titled 'Beginner Table' to get more info about when it was created and who's playing.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over the 'Beginner Table' room card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Additional details such as creation time and player names appear without disrupting the layout.

narrative_steps.title: Joining a Room
narrative_steps.description: Seeing that there’s space and the game hasn't started yet, Sarah clicks the room card to join.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Beginner Table' room card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: She is redirected to the game table page for that specific room.

requirement_tested: Table game interface showing player hand cards, community cards, betting information, and action buttons
user_persona: An active participant ready to make strategic moves during a live Texas Hold'em game.
user_goal: To view personal and shared cards clearly and perform a betting action confidently.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Personal Cards
narrative_steps.description: Mike joins a game room and looks down at his own two face-up cards displayed prominently at the bottom of the screen.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the game table page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: His hole cards are visible only to him, rendered correctly with images from /assets/cards/*.png.

narrative_steps.title: Monitoring Community Cards
narrative_steps.description: As the flop comes out, Mike watches the three central community cards flip over one by one.
narrative_steps.action: Wait for server-sent update indicating the flop has been dealt.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Three community cards appear face-up in the center of the table in real-time.

narrative_steps.title: Making a Decision
narrative_steps.description: Feeling confident after seeing the turn card, Mike decides to raise the bet using the control buttons below the table.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Bet/Raise' button and select an amount using the slider.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A slider appears allowing him to choose his raise amount; upon confirming, the action is sent to the server.

requirement_tested: Real-time chat functionality within game rooms
user_persona: A social player who enjoys chatting while playing poker.
user_goal: To send a quick message to fellow players without interrupting gameplay flow.

narrative_steps.title: Sending a Message
narrative_steps.description: While waiting for others to act, Lisa types a friendly greeting into the chat panel beside the poker table.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'Good luck everyone!' into the chat input field and press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Her message instantly appears in the chat window with her username and timestamp, visible to all players in the room.

narrative_steps.title: Receiving Notifications
narrative_steps.description: Lisa notices a system notification pop up informing her that another player just folded.
narrative_steps.action: Observe incoming WebSocket message about a player folding.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: System-generated message is visually distinct from user messages and appears automatically in the chat area.

requirement_tested: User authentication and account management system
user_persona: A registered user wanting to personalize their profile and track their progress.
user_goal: To update personal information and review previous game outcomes.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Profile Settings
narrative_steps.description: After logging in, Tom clicks on his profile icon in the header to access account settings.
narrative_steps.action: Click the user profile dropdown menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dropdown menu expands revealing options including 'Edit Profile', 'Game History', and 'Logout'.

narrative_steps.title: Updating Information
narrative_steps.description: Tom selects 'Edit Profile' and changes his avatar URL and full name before saving.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'Edit Profile', modify fields, then click 'Save Changes'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Changes are saved via API call and reflected immediately on the profile section.

narrative_steps.title: Reviewing Past Games
narrative_steps.description: Curious about how he played last week, Tom navigates to his game history to check results.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'Game History' from the profile menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: He is taken to a page listing past games with dates, outcomes, and chip gains or losses.

requirement_tested: Ability for users to create new game rooms
user_persona: A group leader organizing a private match with friends.
user_goal: To set up a custom game room with specific rules and invite friends privately.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Room Creation
narrative_steps.description: Jenny wants to host a special tournament night and clicks the 'Create Room' button in the lobby.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Create Room' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal form opens where she can configure room settings like name, blinds, and password protection.

narrative_steps.title: Configuring Settings
narrative_steps.description: Jenny fills in the room name, sets blinds, and adds a password so only invited friends can join.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in form fields and enable password protection.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Form validates inputs properly and allows secure submission with optional password hashing.

narrative_steps.title: Launching the Room
narrative_steps.description: Satisfied with her setup, Jenny hits the 'Create Room' button to launch the new private game.
narrative_steps.action: Click the final 'Create Room' button in the modal.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: New room is created successfully and she is redirected to the empty game table, now listed in the lobby as password-protected.

requirement_tested: Ability for users to join existing game rooms
user_persona: A spontaneous visitor looking to jump into any available game quickly.
user_goal: To scan for open rooms and join one seamlessly without delays.

narrative_steps.title: Browsing Available Rooms
narrative_steps.description: Alex visits the lobby and scans through the list of currently available rooms.
narrative_steps.action: Visit the lobby page and observe the dynamically loaded list of rooms.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Rooms marked as 'waiting' with available seats have enabled 'Join' buttons.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting a Room
narrative_steps.description: Spotting a room named 'Quick Match' with open seats, Alex clicks the 'Join' button.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Join' button for the 'Quick Match' room.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: No password prompt is shown since the room isn’t protected; redirection occurs immediately.

narrative_steps.title: Successful Entry
narrative_steps.description: Alex arrives at the game table and sees his name added to the list of seated players.
narrative_steps.action: Land on the game table page after joining.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: His presence is confirmed visually on the table interface and broadcast to other players.

requirement_tested: Texas Hold'em game logic implementation including betting rounds and hand evaluation
user_persona: A competitive player focused on making optimal decisions throughout each round.
user_goal: To participate fully in all stages of a Texas Hold’em hand and see accurate resolution.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Pre-Flop Round
narrative_steps.description: David receives his hole cards and waits for the pre-flop betting round to begin.
narrative_steps.action: Wait for initial deal and betting round start signal from server.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Cards dealt face-down to him and betting begins with correct blinds posted automatically.

narrative_steps.title: Playing Through Rounds
narrative_steps.description: Over several turns, David checks, calls, and watches the flop, turn, and river unfold.
narrative_steps.action: Perform legal actions (check, call) and wait for community cards to be revealed.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each betting round progresses smoothly, and cards are revealed at appropriate times via WebSocket updates.

narrative_steps.title: Hand Resolution
narrative_steps.description: At showdown, David reveals his hand and waits for the winner to be determined based on official rankings.
narrative_steps.action: Participate in showdown phase until winner is declared.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Winner is announced along with hand ranking comparison performed server-side and distributed to clients.

requirement_tested: Game records/history viewing feature for completed games
user_persona: A reflective player interested in analyzing past performances and strategies.
user_goal: To access historical game data and analyze a particular session in detail.

narrative_steps.title: Finding Historical Data
narrative_steps.description: Raj goes to his profile and selects 'Game History' to look up a game from earlier today.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the game history page via profile menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: List of completed games appears sorted chronologically with basic stats per game.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Specific Game
narrative_steps.description: He finds the right entry and clicks on it to view the detailed sequence of hands and bets.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a specific game row in the history list.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Detailed replay page loads showing card sequences, betting actions, and final results.

requirement_tested: Responsive web design with azure page background and midnight blue UI elements
user_persona: A mobile gamer accessing the site on various devices.
user_goal: To enjoy consistent styling and usability regardless of device type.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Site on Mobile
narrative_steps.description: Priya opens the poker site on her smartphone and checks if everything still looks cohesive.
narrative_steps.action: Open the homepage on a mobile browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Site renders responsively with azure background maintained and midnight blue elements properly scaled.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating Interface
narrative_steps.description: She taps through different sections like lobby and account pages to ensure touch targets work well.
narrative_steps.action: Tap navigation links and interactive elements across pages.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All buttons and links respond appropriately with no overlapping or misaligned components.

requirement_tested: Frontend application with dynamic data fetching from backend APIs
user_persona: An end-user expecting fresh content every time they visit the app.
user_goal: To always see up-to-date information pulled live from backend services.

narrative_steps.title: Fetching Live Data
narrative_steps.description: Upon entering the lobby, Marcus notices the list of rooms updating in real-time as people join and leave.
narrative_steps.action: Load the lobby page and observe dynamic updates.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Room statuses and player counts refresh automatically without manual reloads thanks to WebSocket connections.

requirement_tested: Backend API server connecting to PostgreSQL database using provided environment variables
user_persona: A developer verifying backend connectivity and database integration.
user_goal: To confirm that backend endpoints interact correctly with PostgreSQL using specified credentials.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Database Connection
narrative_steps.description: During deployment, DevOps engineer ensures the backend connects securely using the given DB_* env vars.
narrative_steps.action: Start backend service with environment variables set: DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, etc.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Service initializes successfully and establishes connection to PostgreSQL instance without errors.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Data Retrieval
narrative_steps.description: They test retrieving user profiles to validate ORM mapping and query execution paths.
narrative_steps.action: Make GET request to /api/users/profile endpoint.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Returns valid JSON response containing user data fetched directly from PostgreSQL database.

requirement_tested: Concurrent development setup with npm run dev starting both frontend and backend
user_persona: A developer working on simultaneous front-end and back-end tasks.
user_goal: To streamline local development workflow by launching both environments together.

narrative_steps.title: Running Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Developer runs a single command to bring up both frontend and backend servers for integrated testing.
narrative_steps.action: Execute `npm run dev` from project root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend (typically React/Vue dev server) and backend (Node.js/Express) start concurrently and communicate properly.

requirement_tested: Repository package.json configured with install:all script for frontend and backend dependencies
user_persona: A team member setting up a clean development environment.
user_goal: To simplify dependency installation process for entire stack in one go.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Fresh clone requires installing packages for both client and server applications efficiently.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run install:all` from the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Installs all necessary dependencies for both frontend and backend projects without error.

requirement_tested: Database schema design for storing user accounts, game rooms, game history, and chat messages
user_persona: A database administrator validating schema integrity and relationships.
user_goal: To verify that core entities are represented accurately in the relational model.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Schema Structure
narrative_steps.description: DBA inspects the defined tables to ensure foreign keys align with business logic.
narrative_steps.action: Query database schema for users, game_rooms, game_history, and chat_messages tables.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tables exist with correct columns, constraints, and referential integrity enforced between related entities.

requirement_tested: Real-time synchronization between players during active gameplay
user_persona: Multiple players engaged in synchronous multiplayer poker experience.
user_goal: To maintain synchronized game state among all participants despite network variability.

narrative_steps.title: Observing Sync Accuracy
narrative_steps.description: Players simultaneously watch a new card dealt and confirm timing matches across screens.
narrative_steps.action: Trigger card-dealing event via server and monitor reception on multiple clients.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All connected clients receive identical game state updates at nearly the same moment via WebSocket channel.
